page.title: 20LLANBISTER CHURCH HALL
page.content:
The church hall is in the centre of the village.Built in 1911,it is a wooden frame building, protected on the outside by corrugated iron. Apart from church business, it is used by different organisations for fund raising activities and funeral teas. Whist Drives, Coffee Evenings, and Jumble Sales are popular. from time to time furniture and carpet sales are held there. The Parish Council hold their meetings there as do various committees. It used also for drama and the Chistmas Carol Concert.
Area surveyed by members of Llanbister W.I. with the help of Messrs B.Mackinnon, P Johnson, P.Jennings and Major White.
